org.linphone.core

Interface LinphoneCallParams

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LinphoneCallParamsImpl

    public interface LinphoneCallParams
    The LinphoneCallParams is an object containing various call related parameters. It can be used to retrieve parameters from a currently running call or modify the call's characteristics dynamically.

      • enableLowBandwidth

        void enableLowBandwidth(boolean enable)
        Indicate low bandwith mode. Configuring a call to low bandwidth mode will result in the core to activate several settings for the call in order to ensure that bitrate usage is lowered to the minimum possible. Typically, ptime (packetization time) will be increased, audio codec's output bitrate will be targetted to 20kbit/s provided that it is achievable by the codec selected after SDP handshake. Video is automatically disabled.

      • isLowBandwidthEnabled

        boolean isLowBandwidthEnabled()
        Use to know if this call has been configured in low bandwidth mode.
        When enabled, this param may transform a call request with video in audio only mode.
        Returns:
        true if low bandwidth has been configured/detected

      • setRecordFile

        void setRecordFile(java.lang.String path)
        Set a path to file where the call will be recorded. Actual start of the recording is controlled by LinphoneCall.startRecording().
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file where the call will be recorded. If it is a WAV file, only audio will be written whereas if it is a MKV file, audio and video will be written.

      • addCustomHeader

        void addCustomHeader(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String value)
        Add a custom header to be used for the call for which these call params are used.
        Parameters:
        name - header name
        value - header value

      • getCustomHeader

        java.lang.String getCustomHeader(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the value of a custom header given its name. If no header with that name exists, then null is returned.
        Returns:
        value for the header, or null if it doesn't exist.

      • addCustomSdpAttribute

        void addCustomSdpAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String value)
        Add a custom attribute related to all the streams in the SDP exchanged within SIP messages during a call.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the attribute to add.
        value - The content value of the attribute to add.

      • addCustomSdpMediaAttribute

        void addCustomSdpMediaAttribute(LinphoneCore.StreamType type,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String value)
        Add a custom attribute related to a specific stream in the SDP exchanged within SIP messages during a call.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the stream to add a custom SDP attribute to.
        name - The name of the attribute to add.
        value - The content value of the attribute to add.

      • getCustomSdpAttribute

        java.lang.String getCustomSdpAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        Get a custom SDP attribute that is related to all the streams.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the attribute to get.
        Returns:
        The content value of the attribute or null if not found.

      • getCustomSdpMediaAttribute

        java.lang.String getCustomSdpMediaAttribute(LinphoneCore.StreamType type,
                                            java.lang.String name)
        Get a custom SDP attribute that is related to a specific stream.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the stream to add a custom SDP attribute to.
        name - The name of the attribute to get.
        Returns:
        The content value of the attribute or null if not found.

        Clear the custom SDP attributes related to a specific stream in the SDP exchanged within SIP messages during a call.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the stream to clear custom SDP attributes from.

        Parameters:

        Get the privacy mask requested for this call.
        Returns:
        the privacy mask as defined in interface Privacy

      • setSessionName

        void setSessionName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the session name of the media session (ie in SDP). Subject from the SIP message can be retrieved using linphone_call_params_get_custom_header().
        Parameters:
        name - the session name

      • getSessionName

        java.lang.String getSessionName()
        Get the session name of the media session (ie in SDP). Subject from the SIP message can be retrieved using linphone_call_params_get_custom_header().
        Returns:
        the session name

      • getSentVideoSize

        VideoSize getSentVideoSize()
        Gets the size of the video that is sent.
        Returns:
        The sent video size.

      • getReceivedVideoSize

        VideoSize getReceivedVideoSize()
        Gets the size of the video that is received.
        Returns:
        The received video size.

      • enableAudioMulticast

        void enableAudioMulticast(boolean yesno)
        Use to enable multicast rtp for audio stream. * If enabled, outgoing calls put a multicast address from #linphone_core_get_video_multicast_addr into audio cline. In case of outgoing call audio stream is sent to this multicast address.
        For incoming calls behavior is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        yesno - if yes, subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by LinphoneCore.setAudioMulticastAddr

      • audioMulticastEnabled

        boolean audioMulticastEnabled()
        Use to get multicast state of audio stream.
        Returns:
        true if subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by LinphoneCore.setAudioMulticastAddr

      • enableVideoMulticast

        void enableVideoMulticast(boolean yesno)
        Use to enable multicast rtp for video stream. If enabled, outgoing calls put a multicast address from #linphone_core_get_video_multicast_addr into video cline. In case of outgoing call video stream is sent to this multicast address.
        For incoming calls behavior is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        yesno - if yes, subsequent outgoing calls will propose multicast ip set by LinphoneCore.setVideoMulticastAddr

      • videoMulticastEnabled

        boolean videoMulticastEnabled()
        Use to get multicast state of video stream.
        Returns:
        true if subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by LinphoneCore.setVideoMulticastAddr

      • enableRealTimeText

        void enableRealTimeText(boolean yesno)
        Use to enable real time text following rfc4103. If enabled, outgoing calls put a m=text line in SDP offer .
        Parameters:
        yesno - if yes, subsequent outgoing calls will propose rtt

      • realTimeTextEnabled

        boolean realTimeTextEnabled()
        Use to get real time text following rfc4103.
        Returns:
        returns true if call rtt is activated.

      • getAudioDirection

        LinphoneCore.MediaDirection getAudioDirection()
        Get the audio stream direction.
        Returns:
        The audio stream direction associated with the call params.

      • getVideoDirection

        LinphoneCore.MediaDirection getVideoDirection()
        Get the video stream direction.
        Returns:
        The video stream direction associated with the call params.

      • setAudioDirection

        void setAudioDirection(LinphoneCore.MediaDirection dir)
        Set the audio stream direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The audio stream direction associated with this call params.

      • setVideoDirection

        void setVideoDirection(LinphoneCore.MediaDirection dir)
        Set the video stream direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The video stream direction associated with this call params.

      • getSentFramerate

        float getSentFramerate()
        Gets the FPS sent in a video call.
        Returns:
        the fps

      • getReceivedFramerate

        float getReceivedFramerate()
        Gets the FPS received in a video call.
        Returns:
        the fps
